SENT.plain: Severe pulmonary embolism with thrombosis of the inferior vena cava was observed in a 16 year old girl with no risk factors and treated successfully by fibrinolytic therapy
Secondarily, despite heparino-therapy, upper limb venous thrombosis occurred
Investigation of the clotting factors in the patient and her family revealed a hereditary deficit of antithrombin III
The features of the haemotological diagnosis of this rare condition and the therapeutic implications are discussed
